<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>What a fun weekend of football, baseball, and horror movie marathons. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now to the serious stuff: In case you live in a cave under a rock inside a volcano five miles under the ocean surface, you know the U.S. election takes place next week. But as much as Washington, D.C., dominates the conversation, individual states are dealing with their own unique issues—from tax changes to gig economy laws.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, we'll take you on a tour of the country to spotlight some of the most interesting biz-related items on the ballot Nov. 3. You can check out the first piece in this series (on pot legalization) below.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/25/third-wave-covid19-threatens-us-businesses?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You Always Remember Your <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">First</span> <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">Second</span> Third
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Four charts showing daily tests, daily cases, current hospitalizations, and daily deaths. The daily cases and hospitalizations charts show three spikes in April, July, and a growing one in October. Daily deaths have steadily decreased, but registered a spike in August." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODk1L3RoZV9jb3ZpZF90cmFja2luZ19wcm9qZWN0LmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>The COVID Tracking Project</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">LPT: The lower you set expectations, the less you disappoint. Yesterday, White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows <a href="https://www.axios.com/mark-meadows-pence-marc-short-covid-7befb81b-f76a-4991-8f23-aae8abd12a07.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told CNN</a> "we are not going to control the pandemic," and should instead focus on what we <em>can </em>control, like making vaccines and therapeutics. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But with a record 83,000+ new cases reported both Friday and Saturday, a third wave of Covid-19 is already battering the country and threatening an uneven recovery for U.S. businesses.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Remember the summer?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When daily cases peaked at ~76,000 in July, officials reimposed restrictions on restaurants, public attractions, and gatherings in hard-hit states including California, Florida, Arizona, and Texas.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Airlines reported a drop in already anemic traffic, and Yelp data showed </span><span><a href="https://www.yelpeconomicaverage.com/yea-q3-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">major declines</a></span><span> in business reopenings in June and July. (Just one metro area, Buffalo, NY, experienced an increase.)</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This third wave, however, is the result of rising infections across a larger swath of the country. Clustered in the Midwest and Mountain West, 15 states <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/10/23/world/covid-19-coronavirus-updates?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">added</a> more new cases last week than during any other seven-day period. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot <a href="https://chicago.eater.com/2020/10/22/21528702/ban-indoor-bar-service-restaurant-curfew-second-wave-coronavirus-chicago?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ordered</a> non-essential businesses to close from 10pm–6am and put restrictions on bar and restaurant service. If the city's outbreak doesn't improve, she'll consider another shelter-in-place mandate. Yesterday, authorities in El Paso, TX, <a href="https://www.texastribune.org/2020/10/25/el-paso-coronavirus-stay-home/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asked residents</a> to stay home for a couple weeks following a 300% increase in hospitalizations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, people are worried how well Covid will hit it off with the flu. Shoppers are raiding grocery stores and <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/10/12/covid-19-second-wave-election-fears-stockpile-groceries-toilet-paper/5929592002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stockpiling</a> supplies in case of a fall/winter surge. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Around the world…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Governments are hoping to avoid blanket shutdowns as their own second waves spiral. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In Europe, where cases have more than doubled in the last 10 days, Italy <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-italy/italy-orders-bars-restaurants-to-close-early-as-covid-infections-surge-idUSKBN27A0FA?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is requiring</a> bars and restaurants to close early beginning today—its most intense restrictions since lifting lockdowns this spring. Spain <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-54682222?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">enacted</a> a nightly curfew yesterday and will allow local authorities to restrict regional travel. And lockdowns across Britain are affecting nearly 6 million people. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Like the U.S., some countries are dealing with protests against new restrictions. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The WHO said the Northern Hemisphere is at a "critical juncture" as cases and deaths rise. For the U.S., this third wave will dominate the national conversation heading into next week's election. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/25/jack-ma-talks-ant-group-ipo?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The World According to Jack Ma
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="PARIS, FRANCE - MAY 16: Chairman of Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. Jack Ma d..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODk0L3NhbG9uX3ZpdmFfdGVjaG5vbG9neV8yMDEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Chesnot/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Chinese billionaire behind Alibaba and Ant Group may have <em>officially</em> retired from his corporate roles, but he's still got plenty of opinions...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...which he shared during a <a href="https://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3106949/jack-ma-urges-financial-regulation-reform-eve-ant-groups?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">speech</a> at the Bund Summit in Shanghai on Saturday. Some choice cuts:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On Ant's IPO: </strong>It's going to be the "biggest in history," according to Ma. Ant, the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/20/chinas-ant-group-eyes-huge-ipo?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Chinese fintech giant</a> that could be valued at $300+ billion, is projected to raise more than $30 billion in its upcoming public listing; that would top the $29.4 billion raised by Saudi oil company Aramco last December. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">More on Ant's IPO: </strong>Ma didn’t call NYC a ghost town, but he did say it was a "miracle" that such a big tech IPO would take place in Hong Kong and Shanghai—not on Wall Street.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On financial regulations: </strong>Ma called the current system of global regulations a "club of old people" and said China should overhaul its banking structure to encourage more innovation. As for digital currencies? Ma sees lots of potential.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/25/esg-funds-see-record-inflows-questions-around-regulation-remain?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
ESG Is a Child Star Losing Its Cuteness
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Gas station green " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTYwL2dhc19zdGF0aW9uX2dyZWVuLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The only thing hotter than the city of Tampa Bay right now? ESG funds. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Investors have poured a record $22 billion into ESG exchange-traded funds this year, nearly triple 2019's total, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-25/record-flows-pour-into-esg-funds-as-their-wokeness-is-debated?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to Bloomberg</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's ESG? </strong>It stands for <a href="https://www.cfainstitute.org/en/research/esg-investing?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">environmental, social, and governance</a> issues—and helps you determine the corporations you'd bring home to mom. Identifying companies rated highly on ESG metrics is an increasingly popular way for investors to deploy their money "responsibly."</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But the honeymoon is over</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">First, the SEC doesn't regulate how companies apply the ESG label, so it's kind of like a farm calling itself "organic" without having to run it by anyone. These inconsistencies have led to awkward groupings, like fossil fuel company ExxonMobil's inclusion in one of BlackRock's ESG funds. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And short-sellers <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/b8c91561-b44c-43cf-9810-7aeff9c377a8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">smell blood</a>, the Financial Times reports. These investors, who bet on a company's share price to <em>fall</em>, think the hype around ESG is inflating share prices—which presents an opportunity to make some money. Two companies focused on environmental issues, Nikola and Loop Industries, have recently been attacked by short-seller Hindenburg for exaggerating their tech capabilities.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trying to understand investing today can feel a bit like climbing Mt. Everest—without a sherpa. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So we teamed up with our friends at <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/478914985;283729326;g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Fidelity</a> to help guide us—and other young investors out there—on everything from investing trends to economic shifts to the pandemic’s effect on the market. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Introducing, <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/478914985;283729326;g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Fresh Invest: What to Know When Investing Today</a>—a limited podcast series hosted by our very own Alex Lieberman, CEO of Morning Brew (you know, the media company behind this here newsletter).  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Each week, Alex and a guest from Fidelity will dig into an <em>oh so fresh </em>topic as it relates to investing today, and answer some of the biggest questions on the minds of young investors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The first episode is coming this</strong> <strong style="color:#000">Thursday, 10/29</strong>, and we recommend <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/478914985;283729326;g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">subscribing right here</a> so you’re ready when it drops. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, go polish those earbuds, tell all your best buds, and we’ll see you Thursday with some of the freshest investing knowledge around.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CANNABIS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/25/pot-legalization-5-states-toke-issue?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pot Legalization: 5 More States Toke Up the Issue
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Big marijuana nugget" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yNTAzL2JpZ193ZWVkX251Z2dldC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Each day this week, we'll fill you in on state election topics that have been overshadowed by the national presidential race. Let's kick off the series by exploring this year's marijuana legalization efforts. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>FYI: We are serious business journalists who are above weed puns. Any suggestion otherwise stems chiefly from slander. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Next week, residents of five states—Arizona, Montana, New Jersey, South Dakota, and Mississippi—<a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/12/business/cannabis-ballot-2020-election/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will vote</a> on various legalization measures. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The state of play</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Eleven states plus D.C. have legalized recreational pot. Thirty-three allow medical marijuana. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Legalization is increasingly popular among U.S. voters. According to Pew, 91% of adults think it should be legal either for medical or recreational use. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Voters may be eyeing the economic windfall that legalization can provide. Cannabis sales in states where it's legal totaled about $15 billion last year, and that's projected to double by 2024, per BDS Analytics. And when it's legal, it's taxable, meaning more $$$ for state coffers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> You can accuse us of being coastal elites, but New Jersey is the state to watch. Per CNN, if NJ votes to legalize, neighbors New York and Pennsylvania could be next. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even if it weren't the week before Election Day, we'd still have our hands full with about a third of the S&P 500 reporting earnings and the first reading of Q3 GDP.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"></strong><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>Earnings (Microsoft, Caterpillar, Pfizer, AMD, BP, Crocs) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Senate hearing on Section 230, feat. testimony from Zuck, Jack Dorsey, and Sundar Pichai; earnings (Boeing, UPS, Gilead, Pinterest)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Q3 GDP data; earnings (Apple, Alphabet, Facebook, Twitter, Starbucks, Activision Blizzard); Halloween Eve Eve</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>ExxonMobil earnings; <em>The Mandalorian </em>returns for Season 2; new Ariana Grande album; Halloween Eve </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Saturday: </strong>Halloween </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Start Talking
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every Monday, we curate a handful of balanced resources about a hot-button business issue and encourage you to discuss with friends, family, or coworkers.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Today's topic:</strong> During last week's presidential debate, "wages" was the most-Googled issue in 44 states. While Joe Biden has planted himself firmly on the side of a $15 federal minimum wage, President Trump is arguing for a state-specific floor. Which side are you on?</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A map of minimum wages across the U.S. (</span><span><a href="https://www.epi.org/minimum-wage-tracker/#/min_wage/Washington?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">EPI</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>How many workers will a $15 wage help...and hurt? (</span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2019/07/08/739607964/-15-minimum-wage-would-boost-17-million-workers-cut-1-3-million-jobs-cbo-says?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NPR</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>How a higher minimum wage could help the economy. (</span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/increasing-minimum-wage-would-help-not-hurt-economy-n1244586?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NBC</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some economists are skeptical of a one-size-fits-all approach. (</span><span><a href="https://www.aei.org/carpe-diem/a-one-size-fits-all-15-an-hour-national-minimum-wage-is-really-a-one-size-fits-none-minimum-wage/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">AEI</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The case for regional minimum wages. (</span><span><a href="https://www.thirdway.org/memo/a-regional-minimum-wage?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Third Way</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

So far this month, the major indexes have posted modest gains (the S\u0026P is up more than 3%) despite *gestures at the state of the world*. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGlobal economy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWe'll learn a lot this week, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-25/world-economy-gets-temperature-check-before-u-s-vote-eco-week?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esays Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Central banks in three G7 economies will announce interest rate decisions and countries accounting for 40% of global GDP will shower us with economic growth data.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! The daily cases and hospitalizations charts show three spikes in April, July, and a growing one in October. Daily deaths have steadily decreased, but registered a spike in August.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODk1L3RoZV9jb3ZpZF90cmFja2luZ19wcm9qZWN0LmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe COVID Tracking Project\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLPT: The lower you set expectations, the less you disappoint. Yesterday, White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/mark-meadows-pence-marc-short-covid-7befb81b-f76a-4991-8f23-aae8abd12a07.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold CNN\u003c/a\u003e \"we are not going to control the pandemic,\" and should instead focus on what we \u003cem\u003ecan \u003c/em\u003econtrol, like making vaccines and therapeutics. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut with a record 83,000+ new cases reported both Friday and Saturday, a third wave of Covid-19 is already battering the country and threatening an uneven recovery for U.S. businesses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eRemember the summer?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen daily cases peaked at ~76,000 in July, officials reimposed restrictions on restaurants, public attractions, and gatherings in hard-hit states including California, Florida, Arizona, and Texas.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAirlines reported a drop in already anemic traffic, and Yelp data showed \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.yelpeconomicaverage.com/yea-q3-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajor declines\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in business reopenings in June and July. (Just one metro area, Buffalo, NY, experienced an increase.)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis third wave, however, is the result of rising infections across a larger swath of the country. Clustered in the Midwest and Mountain West, 15 states \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/10/23/world/covid-19-coronavirus-updates?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadded\u003c/a\u003e more new cases last week than during any other seven-day period. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast week, Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot \u003ca href=\"https://chicago.eater.com/2020/10/22/21528702/ban-indoor-bar-service-restaurant-curfew-second-wave-coronavirus-chicago?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eordered\u003c/a\u003e non-essential businesses to close from 10pm–6am and put restrictions on bar and restaurant service. If the city's outbreak doesn't improve, she'll consider another shelter-in-place mandate. Yesterday, authorities in El Paso, TX, \u003ca href=\"https://www.texastribune.org/2020/10/25/el-paso-coronavirus-stay-home/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003easked residents\u003c/a\u003e to stay home for a couple weeks following a 300% increase in hospitalizations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, people are worried how well Covid will hit it off with the flu. Shoppers are raiding grocery stores and \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/10/12/covid-19-second-wave-election-fears-stockpile-groceries-toilet-paper/5929592002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estockpiling\u003c/a\u003e supplies in case of a fall/winter surge. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAround the world…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGovernments are hoping to avoid blanket shutdowns as their own second waves spiral. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn Europe, where cases have more than doubled in the last 10 days, Italy \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-italy/italy-orders-bars-restaurants-to-close-early-as-covid-infections-surge-idUSKBN27A0FA?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis requiring\u003c/a\u003e bars and restaurants to close early beginning today—its most intense restrictions since lifting lockdowns this spring. Spain \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-54682222?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eenacted\u003c/a\u003e a nightly curfew yesterday and will allow local authorities to restrict regional travel. And lockdowns across Britain are affecting nearly 6 million people. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLike the U.S., some countries are dealing with protests against new restrictions. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe WHO said the Northern Hemisphere is at a \"critical juncture\" as cases and deaths rise. For the U.S., this third wave will dominate the national conversation heading into next week's election. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" Jack Ma d...\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yODk0L3NhbG9uX3ZpdmFfdGVjaG5vbG9neV8yMDEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eChesnot/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Chinese billionaire behind Alibaba and Ant Group may have \u003cem\u003eofficially\u003c/em\u003e retired from his corporate roles, but he's still got plenty of opinions...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...which he shared during a \u003ca href=\"https://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3106949/jack-ma-urges-financial-regulation-reform-eve-ant-groups?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espeech\u003c/a\u003e at the Bund Summit in Shanghai on Saturday. Some choice cuts:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOn Ant's IPO: \u003c/strong\u003eIt's going to be the \"biggest in history,\" according to Ma. Ant, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/20/chinas-ant-group-eyes-huge-ipo?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eChinese fintech giant\u003c/a\u003e that could be valued at $300+ billion, is projected to raise more than $30 billion in its upcoming public listing; that would top the $29.4 billion raised by Saudi oil company Aramco last December. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore on Ant's IPO: \u003c/strong\u003eMa didn’t call NYC a ghost town, but he did say it was a \"miracle\" that such a big tech IPO would take place in Hong Kong and Shanghai—not on Wall Street.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOn financial regulations: \u003c/strong\u003eMa called the current system of global regulations a \"club of old people\" and said China should overhaul its banking structure to encourage more innovation. As for digital currencies? Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe only thing hotter than the city of Tampa Bay right now? ESG funds. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInvestors have poured a record $22 billion into ESG exchange-traded funds this year, nearly triple 2019's total, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-25/record-flows-pour-into-esg-funds-as-their-wokeness-is-debated?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaccording to Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's ESG? \u003c/strong\u003eIt stands for \u003ca href=\"https://www.cfainstitute.org/en/research/esg-investing?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eenvironmental, social, and governance\u003c/a\u003e issues—and helps you determine the corporations you'd bring home to mom. Identifying companies rated highly on ESG metrics is an increasingly popular way for investors to deploy their money \"responsibly.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut the honeymoon is over\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFirst, the SEC doesn't regulate how companies apply the ESG label, so it's kind of like a farm calling itself \"organic\" without having to run it by anyone. These inconsistencies have led to awkward groupings, like fossil fuel company ExxonMobil's inclusion in one of BlackRock's ESG funds. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd short-sellers \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/b8c91561-b44c-43cf-9810-7aeff9c377a8?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esmell blood\u003c/a\u003e, the Financial Times reports. These investors, who bet on a company's share price to \u003cem\u003efall\u003c/em\u003e, think the hype around ESG is inflating share prices—which presents an opportunity to make some money. Two companies focused on environmental issues, Nikola and Loop Industries, have recently been attacked by short-seller Hindenburg for exaggerating their tech capabilities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEach day this week, we'll fill you in on state election topics that have been overshadowed by the national presidential race. Let's kick off the series by exploring this year's marijuana legalization efforts. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFYI: We are serious business journalists who are above weed puns. Any suggestion otherwise stems chiefly from slander. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNext week, residents of five states—Arizona, Montana, New Jersey, South Dakota, and Mississippi—\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/12/business/cannabis-ballot-2020-election/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill vote\u003c/a\u003e on various legalization measures. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe state of play\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEleven states plus D.C. have legalized recreational pot. Thirty-three allow medical marijuana. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLegalization is increasingly popular among U.S. voters. According to Pew, 91% of adults think it should be legal either for medical or recreational use. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eVoters may be eyeing the economic windfall that legalization can provide. Cannabis sales in states where it's legal totaled about $15 billion last year, and that's projected to double by 2024, per BDS Analytics. And when it's legal, it's taxable, meaning more $$$ for state coffers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e You can accuse us of being coastal elites, but New Jersey is the state to watch.
